active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate: 'Should organizations prioritize business logic testing (e.g., approval workflow manipulation) over traditional code scanning tools for web applications? Support your position with case studies from OWASP Top 10 or real breaches, and counterarguments from peers.'
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Penetration Testing. Topic: 'Approval Workflow Manipulation' (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Penetration Testing And Ethical Hacking > Web Application Penetration Testing > 012_Business Logic Testing > Workflow Circumvention > Approval Workflow Manipulation). Incorporate these pedagogical elements: - Bloom's Taxonomy objectives: [insert full learning_objectives array here]. - Active learning: Tie flashcards to discussion (e.g., debate prompts), peer teaching (teach-back Qs), labs (DVWA/Juice Shop scenarios). - Scaffolding: Distribute across 4 layers [insert full scaffolding here]. - Research context: Core concepts (approval workflow, manipulation); vectors (IDOR, Broken Access Control, social engineering); standards (OWASP Testing Guide v4, PTES, NIST SP 800-115, OWASP Top 10). Generate 25 high-quality flashcards following this exact schema for each: { "flashcard_id": 1, "bloom_level": "REMEMBER", "scaffolding_layer": "Layer 1", "front": "Question text", "back": { "answer": "Correct answer", "options": ["A) Distractor1", "B) Correct", "C) Distractor2", "D) Distractor3"] (for MCQ; omit for short answer), "explanation": "Detailed why correct/others wrong, link to objective/activity/standard/lab.", "source": "e.g., OWASP Testing Guide v4" } } Use distractor protocol: 3 plausible based on misconceptions. Balance: 40% remember/understand, 30% apply/analyze, 30% evaluate/create. Ensure ethical focus (pen testing only). Output as JSON array of flashcards.
